alert.note: Alert for Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 2:02PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN TAOS AND NORTHEASTERN RIO ARRIBA COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM MDT... At 202 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Antonito, or 27 miles east of Chama, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Taos and northeastern Rio Arriba Counties. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 385 and 407. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 208 and 216, and near Mile Marker 220. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley
